properties.address: High Comon Road, East Kilbride, Glasgow G74 2AU
properties.description: Free drinks and snacks. Free WiFi. Pick up point for local food bank. Advice on contact for help with finance and energy.
properties.title: Cafe Clare at Claremont Parish Church

properties.address: 12 Maxwell Drive, South Lanarkshire, South Lanarkshire G74 4HG
properties.description: This is held in our main church every 1st, 3rd and 5th Wednesday from 12.30 – 2pm. This is a great place for adults to make new friends and chat over lunch of lovely homemade soup/sandwiches and cakes for a small cost of £2.
properties.title: Chit Chat Cafe

properties.address: 12 Maxwell Drive, East Kilbride, South Lanarkshire G74 4HG
properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 13th August 2024** For adults who are feeling isolated, lonely or recently bereaved, Revive Café is a relaxed and non-judgmental space to find friendship and support. Come and socialise, have a brew and get involved in our group. We do art, play music, games, chat about life and have refreshments. We are here every Tuesday evening from 7 – 8.30pm. An opportunity to connect with new people.
properties.title: Revive Wellbeing Cafe

properties.address: Auld Stanehoose Cross Cafe, Lanarkshire ML9 3LQ
properties.description: Don't sit alone in a cold house but come along for a free hot drink anytime and a free soup at lunchtime, and maybe even a free hug from Sally. Tuesdays to Fridays 10am to 2.30pm

hours._text: Tuesday: 10:00 - 14:30, Wednesday: 10:00 - 14:30 / 10:00, Thursday: 10:00 - 14:30, Friday: 10:00 - 14:30, Saturday: 10:00 - 14:30 Fortnightly

properties.title: Stonehouse Warm Welcome

properties.address: Maxwellton Road, East Kilbride, GLASGOW, Lanarkshire G74 3LW
properties.description: A community space with free tea/coffee, soup where you can connect and chat with others in the community
properties.title: Taste & See Lunch Club

properties.address: Moncreiff Parish Church, South Lanarkshire G74 3JJ
properties.description: Thursday mornings 9am - 1pm term time and 10am - 1pm during school holidays. Tea, coffee, toast, light snacks and from around noon soup and a roll. Meeting in the cafe area of the Sanctuary and open to all. Drop in for a while or stay all morning. Play board games, bring your crafts and have a good blether. Lots of practical hep and advice along with sign posting to other relevant sources. CAP Debt Help drop in - no appointment needed. Blankets and new hot water bottles to take away. Battery packs available. Charge your devices. Use our laptops.
properties.title: The Kettle’s On
